title: Flash 10.0 crash under _pthread_start @+0x003a99** or +0x003aa9** (showing file chooser)

sentences.text: This crash was detected in 4.0.211.2 and appears to be a regression from 4.0.207.0.
It is currently ranked #3 (based on the relative number of reports in the release).
There have been 84 reports from 82 clients.
CPU Info: GenuineIntel family 6 model 7 stepping 10
(No comment was entered for this change.)
Looking over the stability measures this is probably the single most important  roadblock for us meeting our stability goals for Mac Beta.
There is no useful information in this crash dump beyond "the plugin process crashed."  No crash stack, no URL,  etc.
Since it looks as though there's no plugin library loaded yet, it may be related to recent changes that made  plugin loading more asynchronous.
But it's not even clear if these reports are all one crash--there may be  multiple crashes getting lumped together because there's no symbol information for the crashed thread...
This crash was found in 4.0.220.1 and is currently ranked #4 (based on the relative number of reports in the release).
There have been 128 reports from 119 clients.
This crash was found in 4.0.221.8 and is currently ranked #11 (based on the relative number of reports in the release).
There have been 24 reports from 19 clients.

I went through the first page of crashes from the last dev release, and the only thing  that looks even remotely like this there has 4 frames of Flash instead of 4 blank  frames (which aren't shown above, but are there in the actual dump).
Given that, I  think it's safe to assume that it's the same, and we are now getting better crash info.
With a plugin and addresses, hopefully we can do something useful.
My only difficulty with that diagnosis is that according to the crash dump, Flash Player  wasn't even loaded at the time of the crash.
This makes me skeptical that this is the  same crash as the one with 4 Flash Player frames, but I guess that's the closest we've  got.
It appears that the stack in http://crash/reportdetail?reportid=0813b1a650943cf9  is trying to display a file chooser (so, at a guess, this is the Gmail attachment widget or  something similar).
(No comment was entered for this change.)
We have no repro case for this, it's actually not particularly common, and we don't even  know that it's not simply a Flash bug;
I would suggest we move this out of Mstone- 4/ReleaseBlock-Beta.
In fact, it seems to be pretty rare.
I think the crashbot rankings are probably bogus, and  comment 2 may be based on a grouping of all _pthread_start Flash bugs together (most  of which aren't this one)
(No comment was entered for this change.)

(No comment was entered for this change.)
(No comment was entered for this change.)
Comment 6 is 10.0r32, as is a slight variant:
I can't find this one on Mozilla's crash servers, so there may be something about our hosting that is causing this.
(No comment was entered for this change.)

Closing all the Flash 10.0 crash trackers;
no need to track them now that we are bundling 10.1.
